body:
Comment 3 by **ankar71**: 
I think it is acceptable to force the developer to build some additional targets so that
the gotest could locate 
easily the modules that have to be tested. The simplest solution would be to have a test
library where gotest 
will expect to find all the modules for which a test function exists (I believe gotest
is working in a similar way 
right now). So the gotest could be simply:
a) extract the test functions
b) generate the glue code to run the test functions
c) compile and link the whole stuff with the a test library that will be created from a
target provided by the 
developer
d) run the tests

The places to look for source files and libs could be given from command line options.
